availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Peter Hinkle (Knox County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier)

body.p: Knox County, Kentucky farmer and soldier. North Carolina native. Married to Sally Ann Valentine Hinkle in Knox County, Kentucky on June 1, 1854. Father of Martha Ann Hinkle, John T. Hinkle, William A. Hinkle, Isaac S. Hinkle, and Mary J. Hinkle. Farmer in Knox County, Kentucky in 1860. Served in the 7th Kentucky Infantry (U.S.A.) as 1st Lieutenant from September 22, 1861 to June 4, 1863. Served in the 7th Kentucky Infantry (U.S.A.) as Captain from June 4, 1863 to August 27, 1863.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Knox County, Flat Lick, p. 60.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Josh Bell County, District 1, p. 212A.
